result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kolby Alexander Davids

defendant.name: Davids, Kolby Alexander
defendant.address: N8435 County Road Ch, Westfield, WI 53964

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kolby Alexander Davids in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Kolby Alexander Davids in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
16CF77, 16CF73, 16CF58 & 16CF57 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2 in 16CF77 and Ct. 1 in 16CF57.  All other counts in these matters to be dismissed and read-in along with 16CF73 & 16CF58.   Atty Hendee states that he is the special prosecuter in Juneau County case 17CF19 that will be resolved soon.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea on both matters.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 16CF77 and Ct. 1 in 16CF57.  All other counts in these matters to be dismissed and read-in along with 16CF73 & 16CF58.

Atty Hendee states that both parties are waiving a PSI.  Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2 in 16CF77 and Ct. 1 in 16CF57:  Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions:
9 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on Ct. 1 in 16CF57
Report forthwith
May serve in Waushara County
Credit = 85 days (if revoked)
Court Costs = $268.00 on each count
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge on each count
AODA and any follow-up treatment  
Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Cash bond in 16CF73 to be applied

All other counts in these matters to be dismissed and read-in along with 16CF73 & 16CF58.

Defendant Kolby Alexander Davids in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Kolby Alexander Davids in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF57, 16CF58, 16CF73 & 16CF77 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today in 16CF73 & 16CF77.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause in both cases that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Cases bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information for both cases with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information in both cases and waives their reading.
  Defendant stands mute on both cases.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant in 16CF73 & 16CF77.

Atty Gumz motions the court for bond reduction in 16CF77.  Atty Hendee responds and asks the court to deny the motion.
BY THE COURT:  Bond modification motion is denied.
Set for Return
bond continued  
  Return date scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kolby Alexander Davids in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF57 & 16CF58 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today in both cases.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information in both cases and waives the reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant for both cases.
Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from from Atty Hendee to reset Prelim set for October 19th; officer not availabe.  Ok'd by Judge.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kolby Alexander Davids in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kolby Alexander Davids in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CF58 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint in both matters & waives it's reading. Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim in both cases. 

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions on each case.
*Appear for booking today
Set for Prelim  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
